original: Brunnström, Henrik Carl Johan (John), läroverksadjunkt, Karlskrona, f. 28/3/82 i Wä, Krist. 1., av kyrkoh. Emil B. o. Sophie-Louise Tellander. G. 1. 14-19 m. Ingrid Lindahl; 2. 28 m. Greta Nilson. Barn: Margareta f. 16, g. m. kapt. O. v. Rosen, Kristianistad, Nils 19, ing., fänr. i res., Sthlm, John-01o’f 29. — Stud:ex. i Kristianstad 01, fil. kand. i Lund 1:1, fil. mag. s. å., provår 12. Res. t. Tyskl. o. Österr. 22, medf. korvetten Freja på Medelhavsresan 011-02. E. kadett o. kadett i flottan 0il-04. E. lär. v. Malmö re-alsk. 05-06, ämneslär. i Skurup 08-10, vik. adj. i Halmstad 11, ämneslär. i Solleifteå 13, e. lär. i Växjö 13-14, adj. i matem. o. fysik v. Karlskrona h. a. 1. sed. 14, vik. lektor där 19-24, lär. v. kvinnl. gymn. där 18-28. Aktuarie i Livränte- o. Kapitalförsäkr :anst. i Blek. sed. 21. Skr.: Redog. över försök att genom vitaminprep :utdeln. åt elever söka inverka på frekvensen av s. k. förkyln :sjukd. (i Karlskrona h. a. 1. årsredogör. 38), Yrkesråd även inom läroverken (Tidskr. f. Sv:e’s Läroverk nr 5 38), rec. i Tidskr. f. Sv:es Läroverk o. Religion o. Kultur samt tidn:-upps.
translated: Brunnström, Henrik Carl Johan (John), high school teacher, Karlskrona, b. 28/3/82 in Wä, Krist. 1., son of vicar Emil B. and Sophie-Louise Tellander. Married 1st in 1914-1919 to Ingrid Lindahl; 2nd in 1928 to Greta Nilson. Children: Margareta b. 1916, married to Captain O.V. Rosen in Kristianstad; Nils b. 1919, engineer, lieutenant in the reserve, Stockholm; John-Olof b. 1929. Education: graduated from Kristianstad in 1901, bachelor's degree in Lund in 1901, Master's degree the same year, probationary year in 1912. Traveled to Germany and Austria in 1922, accompanied the corvette Freja on a Mediterranean trip 1911-1912. Became a cadet and officer in the navy from 1904-1906. Worked as a teacher at Malmö high school from 1905-1906, subject teacher in Skurup from 1908-1910, substitute teacher in Halmstad in 1911, subject teacher in Sollefteå in 1913, former teacher in Växjö from 1913-1914, teacher in mathematics and physics at Karlskrona high school from 1914 onwards, acting lecturer there from 1919-1924, and teacher at the women's gymnasium there from 1918-1928. Actuary at the Life Insurance and Capital Insurance Institution in Blekinge from 1921 onwards. Publications: Account of attempts to distribute vitamin supplements to students in an attempt to affect the frequency of so-called cold illnesses (in Karlskrona high school's annual report for 1938), Professional advice also within high schools (Journal for Swedish high schools in 1938), reviews in Journal for Swedish high schools and Religion and Culture, as well as newspaper articles.

professionalHistory.name: Cadet and officer in the Navy
Teacher in mathematics and physics at Karlskrona High School
